'Spring' (known outside of the United States and in subsequent reissues as
"American Spring") is the first and only album by American pop duo American
Spring (then known as "Spring") released in July, 1972. Largely ignored at the
time of its release, it has now come to be seen as a valuable collector's item
due to Brian Wilson of The Beach Boys' participation.
It has been hypothesised that Brian Wilson's contributions to the 1972 Beach
Boys album, [[Carl and the Passions - "So Tough"]] were minimal as the sessions
coincided with the recording and promotion of this album.
